block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
THEATER
Bellport ''The Nerd'' by Larry Shue, presented by the Playcrafters. Friday through May 5. $12 to $25. Bellport Middle School Auditorium, Kreamer Street and Station Road. (631) 924-8516.

Dix Hills ''Little Women,'' musical by Allan Knee, Mindi Dickstein and Jason Howland, adapted from the book by Louisa May Alcott, directed by Ryan McKinney. Thursday through April 29. $15; seniors and students, $12. Dix Hills Center for the Performing Arts, 305 North Service Road. (631) 656-2148.
East Farmingdale ''This Is Our Youth'' by Kenneth Lonergan. Through April 22. $18 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
East Islip ''Lovers and Other Strangers,'' comedy by Renee Taylor and Joseph Bologna. Through April 22. $14 to $22. BayWay Arts Center, 265 East Main Street. (631) 581-2700.

Stony Brook Shakespeare's ''As You Like It,'' directed by Valeri Lantz-Gefroh. Through April 29. $7 and $12. Shakespeare's ''Romeo and Juliet,'' presented by Aquila Theater Company. April 28 at 8 p.m. $32. Staller Center for the Arts, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-2787.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Bay Shore Patty Larkin, singer-songwriter. Friday at 8 p.m. $30. Colin Hay, acoustic guitar. April 28 at 8 p.m. $30. Judy Collins, folk. April 29 at 3 and 7 p.m. $50. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.

Brookville The Shanghai Quartet; works by Schumann and Schubert. April 22 at 3 p.m. $40. ''Cowboy Cabaret: A Salute to Gene Autry,'' presented by Riders in the Sky. Friday at 8 and 10 p.m. $30. Bach's ''Brandenburg Concertos,'' presented by the Orchestra of St. Luke's. April 28 at 8 p.m. $45 to $90. Festival concert presented by the C. W. Post Band, conducted by James W. McRoy and Joel M. Levy. April 29 at 3 p.m. $8; students, $5. Tilles Center for the Performing Arts, 720 Northern Boulevard, C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University. (516) 299-3100.
Farmingdale Kittie with Walls of Jericho, In This Moment and others, hard rock. April 22 at 3 p.m. $15 and $17. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.

Garden City The Waldorf Choral Society; Te Deums, early Christian hymns of praise. April 28 at 8 p.m. $18 to $20; children under 12, $5. Cathedral of the Incarnation, 50 Cathedral Avenue. (631) 293-2222.
Old Westbury ''Great Sounds of Jazz,'' presented by the Agora Quartet. April 29 at 3 p.m. Free. Salten Hall, New York Institute of Technology, Old Westbury Campus, Northern Boulevard. (516) 686-7640.
Patchogue Canta Libre, flute, harp and strings trio. April 22 at 3 p.m. $5. O'Connor Hall, St. Joseph's College, Suffolk Campus. (631) 447-7434.

Patchogue The Nelson Riddle Orchestra. April 22 at 3 p.m. $25 to $40. ''Spring Spectacular,'' presented by the Atlantic Wind Symphony. April 29 at 3 p.m. $15; seniors and students, $12. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.
Sag Harbor Portland Taiko, Japanese drummers. April 22 at 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. $12. Bay Street Theater, Main and Bay Streets. (631) 725-9500.
Stony Brook Classical Spring Chorale, with Rachel Schutz, soprano, and Deanna Muro, organ. April 22 at 4 p.m. $10 and $12. Stony Brook Community Church, 216 Christian Avenue. (631) 751-0574.

Westbury ''Solid Gold Saturday Night,'' with Herman's Hermits, Blood, Sweat and Tears and others. April 28 at 7 p.m. $46.50 to $56.50. Gordon Lightfoot, folk. April 29 at 7 p.m. $45 to $55. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
FILM

Westhampton Beach Finest in World Cinema Series: ''The Lives of Others,'' directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. April 22 at 1 and 4 p.m. $3 to $10. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
OUTDOORS

Huntington ''Spring Seasonal Stroll,'' adult nature walk. April 22 at 1 p.m. $3; reservations required. ''Caumsett Sampler,'' adult nature hike along five-mile trail. April 28 at 10 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.

Oakdale ''Hiker's Special,'' six-mile hike with stops to discuss the ecology of the park. April 28 at 9:30 a.m. $3; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.

Oyster Bay Arbor Day Festival, with National Circus Project, tree planting and a family concert. April 28 and 29. $5; children, $1. Planting Fields Arboretum State Historic Park, 1395 Planting Fields Road. (516) 922-9200.
Smithtown ''Southside Saunter,'' adult nature hike. April 28 at 10 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caleb Smith State Park Preserve, Jericho Turnpike. (631) 265-1054.
SPOKEN WORD

Cold Spring Harbor ''Louis Comfort Tiffany and the Laurelton Inn -- An Artist's Country Estate,'' lecture by Catherine Lawrence of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Cold Spring Harbor Library, 95 Harbor Road. (631) 692-6820.
Farmingdale Keith Flynn, poet. Thursday at 11 a.m. Free. Ward Hall, 2350 Broadhollow Road, Farmingdale State College. (631) 420-2739.

Lawrence ''George Washington Didn't Sleep at Rock Hall and Other Tales of Long Island Travelers,'' lecture on historic Long Island, presented by Natalie Naylor. April 22 at 1:30 p.m. Free. Rock Hall Museum, 199 Broadway. (516) 239-1157.
COMEDY
Westbury Kathy Griffin, stand-up. April 22 at 7 p.m. $41.50 to $51.50. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
FOR CHILDREN
East Farmingdale ''Velveteen Rabbit,'' adapted from the story by Margery Williams. Through May 27. $8. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
East Islip ''Beauty and the Beast,'' children's play followed by tea party. Saturdays through May 5. $8; $20 for show and tea party. BayWay Arts Center, 265 East Main Street. (631) 581-2700.
Lindenhurst ''Aladdin,'' children's theater followed by a tea party. Saturdays through May 19. $8; $20 for show and tea party. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.

Oakdale ''Night of the Frogs,'' learn about frogs and hunt for them in the park. All ages. Friday at 7 p.m. ''The Giving Tree.'' Learn about trees and how they protect the earth. Ages 5 and up. April 28 at 2 p.m. Both: $3; children, $2; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.

Riverhead ''Madagascar's Buried Treasure: Discoveries of Dinosaurs in the Land That Time Forgot,'' presentation by David Krause, paleobiologist. April 28 at 1 p.m. $11; seniors and children 12 to 18, $9; children 3 to 11, $8; children 2 and under, free. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.

Riverhead Earth Day. Learn about environmental methods including recycling and alternative energy. April 22, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. $2; children, $5. Long Island Science Center, 11 West Main Street. (631) 208-8000.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Bellport ''Spring 2007 Exhibition,'' paintings by various artists. Through April 30. Free. Hours: Saturdays, 1 to 5 p.m. Ratio Gallery, 10 Bell Street. (631) 286-4020.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $4; seniors and students, $3; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.

Dix Hills ''Visionary Anatomies,'' works by 11 artists inspired by human anatomical imagery. Through May 31. Reception: April 29, 3 to 5 p.m. Jeanie Tengelsen Gallery, 107 East Deer Park Road. (631) 462-5400.

East Hampton ''LongHouse Reserve Rites of Spring,'' season opening with installations by Dale Chihuly, Shinman Yamada and Dennis Oppenheim. April 28 at 2 p.m. $8 to $10. LongHouse Reserve Art Center, 133 Hands Creek Road. (631) 329-3568.
East Hampton ''Early Spring Show,'' works by nine furniture makers. Through May 22. Free. Pritam and Eames, 29 Race Lane. (631) 324-7111.

East Hampton Paintings and mixed media works by Peter Dayton, Robert Kelly, Rex Lau, Alan Shields and Kelly Spalding. Through April 30. Free. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Drawing Room, 16R Newtown Lane. (631) 324-5016.

East Islip ''Surface Impressions,'' works by artists exploring the idea of surface in canvas, sculpture and mixed-media. Through June 3. Donation: $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.
Huntington ''Unlikely Materials,'' works by various artists. Through April 28. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''Bebe Identity,'' photographs by Richard Gardner. Through April 29. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington ''Long Island's Best: Young Artists at the Heckscher,'' works by high school students. Through May 6. Reception: April 22, 5 to 7 p.m. $5; seniors, $3; children ages 5 to 12, $1; under 5, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays, 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 8:30 p.m. Heckscher Museum of Art, 2 Prime Avenue. (631) 351-3250.

Melville ''Fresh Air,'' works by Sanford Forrester, Barbara Gruber, Donald Thiergard and M. Ellen Winter. Through June 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Art-trium, 25 Melville Park Road. (631) 271-8423.

Oakdale ''The Living Classroom: Now Present at this Moment,'' multimedia installations by Ahn Pilyun. Through April 29. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Anthony Giordano Gallery, Dowling College, Idle Hour Boulevard. (631) 244-3016.

Quogue ''Local Color,'' works by Carolyn Munoco Haines and Meryl Spiegel. Through April 30. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.

Rockville Centre Pen and pencil drawings of Victorian architecture by Erin McCauley. Through June 3. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Phillips House, 28 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 764-7459.

Roslyn Harbor ''Rembrandt to Rosenquist: The Masters of Printmaking.'' Through May 13. ''Twenty-First Century Prints,'' works by Elizabeth Peyton, John Currin and other contemporary printmakers. Through May 13. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.
Southampton Works by Irene Zevon. Through April 30. Free. Hours: Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Bravura Art and Objects, 22 Nugent Street. (631) 259-2605.

Southampton ''Raymond Loewy: Designs for a Consumer Culture,'' works by the 20th-century industrial designer. Through May 27. $7; seniors and students, $5; children under 18, free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.

St. James ''28th Annual Juried Photography Exhibition.'' Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Mills Pond House Gallery, 660 Route 25A. (631) 862-6575.

Stony Brook ''Living the American Dream: Levittown and the Suburban Boom.'' Through July 8. ''William Sidney Mount: The Education of an Artist.'' Through Sept. 30. $7; seniors, $6; students, $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.

Uniondale ''Paper Tapestries,'' works made of woven paper by Sage Reynolds. Through April 30. Free. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Uniondale Public Library, 400 Uniondale Avenue. (516) 489-2220.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
